title: Sydney man dies in his sleep from rare epilepsy condition his doctor mother had never heard of
text:
A doctor says she is 'ashamed' to have never heard of an incredibly rare condition that claimed her son's life as he slept.

George Murrett, from Sydney, died in his sleep from sudden unexpected death in epilepsy (SUDEP) - the sudden death of a person with epilepsy where no cause is found.

The 29-year-old - who was diagnosed with epilepsy when he was 14 - died after a late night out of partying.

He had been drinking alcohol and forgot to take his epilepsy medication.

George Murrett (right) died in his sleep over the weekend from a rare condition that affects epileptics. His mother Dr Anna Murrett (left) said she had never heard of it

The Citibank worker's housemates were away for the weekend, and nobody knew he died until he didn't show up for work the following Monday.

His mother, Dr Anny Marrett, said he hadn't been sleeping well in the lead up to his death.

'He'd been at a party and he'd come home late; he'd had a few drinks. He might not have taken his medication dose before the party,' the GP told news.com.au.

'A friend called him around lunch to ask him for golf but he turned it down because he was too tired. We think a combination of lack of sleep, missing tablets and having a few drinks possibly contributed to his death.'

Dr Marrett received the heartbreaking news on Monday morning, after her son failed to show up to work.

'I'm a GP but I hadn't heard of the condition, I'm ashamed to say. There's more awareness about SIDS,' she said.

The 29-year-old's (pictured) housemates were away for the weekend, and nobody knew he died until he didn't show up for work the following Monday

There are roughly 300 epilepsy-related deaths in Australia every year, with around half of those stemming from SUDEP.

The rare condition occurs in around one in every 1,000 Australians with epilepsy.

In most cases, the person is found to have passed away in bed while they were asleep.

authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
